bibliography:
Adams, Robert Merrihew, 1999, Finite and Infinite Goods: A
Framework for Ethics, Oxford and New York: Oxford University
Press.

Adorno, Theodor W., 1989, Kierkegaard: Construction of the
Aesthetic, Robert Hullot-Kentor (trans.), Minneapolis: University
of Minnesota Press.

Agacinski, Sylviane, 1988, Aparté: Conceptions and
Deaths of Søren Kierkegaard, trans. Kevin Newmark,
Tallahassee: Florida State University Press.

Bigelow, Pat, 1987, Kierkegaard & The Problem Of
Writing, Tallahassee: Florida State University Press.

Billeskov Jansen, F.J., 1951, Studier i Søren
Kierkegaards litterœre Kunst, Copenhagen: Rosenkilde &
Bagger.

Bloom, Harold (ed.), 1989, Søren Kierkegaard, New
York: Chelsea House Publishers.

Brandes, Georg, 1877, Søren Kierkegaard. En kritisk

Carlisle, Clare, 2005, Kierkegaard’s Philosophy of

Davenport John J., 2012, Narrative Identity and Autonomy: from

Derrida, Jacques, 1995, The Gift of Death, trans. David

Diderichsen, Adam, 1998, Den Sårede Odysseus.

Dooley, Mark, 2001, The Politics of Exodus:

Emmanuel, Steven, William McDonald and Jon Stewart (eds.),
2013–2015, Kierkegaard’s Concepts Tomes I to VI,

Evans, C. Steven, 2004, Kierkegaard’s Ethic of Love:

Ferguson, Harvie, 1995, Melancholy and the Critique of

–––, 1991, Transforming Vision: Imagination

–––, 1995, Den søvnløse.

–––, 1997, Subjektivitet og negativitet:

Hampson, Daphne, 2013, Kierkegaard: Exposition and

Hannay, Alastair, 1982, Kierkegaard, London: Routledge

Hannay, Alastair and Gordon Marino (eds.), 1997, The Cambridge

Henriksen, Aage, 1954, Kierkegaards Romaner, Copenhagen:

Kirmmse, Bruce H., 1996, Encounters with Kierkegaard: A Life

––– (ed.), 1990, Kierkegaard in Golden Age

–––, 2013, Kierkegaard and the Problem of

–––, 2000, Humour and Irony in

Lippitt, John and George Pattison (eds.), 2013, The Oxford

Lowrie, Walter, 1962, Kierkegaard, 2 volumes, New York:

Roos, Carl, 1955, Kierkegaard og Goethe, Copenhagen: Gads

–––, 2005, Living Christianly:

Westphal, Merold & Martin J. Matustik, 1995, Kierkegaard
